oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eddie Hill Show (Tape 1)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording features a conversation between radio host, Eddie Hill and Hank Snow. Ray Price, Hal Cook, and Don Law are also in the studio talking to Eddie Hill. The conversation is primarily about the previous nights show and Snow's life story. Hill does announce songs that were played in real time but are not included on this recording. The tape is dated April of 1957. This tape is fifty of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Hill; Hank Snow; Ernest Tubb; Ray Price; Hal Cook; Don Law;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mid conversation with an intoxicated Hank Snow and unidentified friend making a vow to stop drinking -- (01:33) Men cut out and unidentified song starts to play (Unidentified) -- (01:51) The radio host announces the radio program, Opry Star Spotlight with Hank Snow -- (02:34) Host, Eddie Hill introduces Snow -- (03:22) Hill announces next song, "Where'd You Go and When You're Coming Back" (Lee Emerson and Marty Robbins) -- (03:40) Hill reintroduces Snow and introduces Dow Law, Ray Price, and Hal Cook -- (04:16) Hill and Snow talk about the previous nights show with Roy Acuff and Ernest Tubb -- (05:10) Hill asks Snow where he's from -- (05:42) Hill and Snow talk about Snow's family -- (06:02) Hill and Snow talk about how he got started -- (06:42) Snow talks about how he went to sea when he was 12 years old -- (06:54) Hill asks if when Snow first started he owned his own guitar - (07:13) Snow talks about how when he first started he sang with no music -- (07:35) Snow tells how he got his first guitar -- (08:33) Snow says that he first learned how to play Hawaiian guitar with his mom -- (08:49) Hill asks Snow more about the kind of ships he worked on -- (10:13) Hill announces the time, program, and the next song, "My Two Timin' Woman" (Hank Snow) -- (11:19) Hill and Snow talk about the song he just played -- (12:38) Hill asks Snow when he felt like a professional -- (13:12) Snow tells the story of his audition with a radio station -- (14:24) Snow and Hill talk about adding members to Snow's band -- (15:05) Hill asks Snow what kind of places he played when he first started out -- (16:11) Hill announces time, program, and the next song "I'm Rough Stuff" (Bill Carlisle) -- (16:36) Hill and Snow talk about recording -- (17:06) Hill asks Snow which artists in the country world he likes -- (17:44) Hill and Snow talk about radio and the Grand Ole Opry -- (19:34) Hill and Snow talk about when Snow left Canada and moved to the USA -- (20:31) Snow talks about how great Canada is -- (21:18) Hill asks Snow where he wanted to end up with once in the States -- (22:16) Snow talks about other famous people who are in the States and are Canadian -- (23:11) Hill asks what kind of car Snow was driving when he moved -- (23:41) Snow tells how he traveled back and forth between the USA and Canada --(24:08) Snow talks about when he went to Hollywood -- (25:15) Snow tells about how and why he moved to Dallas, Texas [conversation and tape cut out] [conversation continues on tape 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1994; Hill, Eddie, 1921-1995; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Cook, Hal (music executive); Law, Don, 1902-1982; Law, Donald F., 1902-1982;
